content: Where would someone go in this community on what channel and topic is we were in search of looking for people willing to help us build a self-hosting server and Admin it for $$$ ? Thanks in advance for any help with this topic. :)
A message was moved here from #development help > âœ” About get_recipient_label method by Tim Abbott.
Tim Abbott has marked this topic as unresolved.
@Gary Adams you can contact sales@zulip.com with details on your installation, its number of users, and what services you're looking for to get a support quote.

But generally we recommend using our hosted option at Zulip Cloud if that's an option for you and you want to pay to have a server professionally managed; it's likely to be cheaper and better managed.
(There can be compliance or other reasons that might not be an option)
Good afternoon guys I am trying to setup a self hosted server but am unable too, if anyone has the time to help me that would be great
Hi blackbird, if you can provide a description of what exactly you're stuck on, someone here would be happy to help however they can.
I cant access the web browser
with the one time link
if anyone can help me I am down to get into a call so u can show me how it is done or if you wanna explain that is fine too
For some reason when I install the new version of self hosted Zylip you cant access the local web interface
image.png

./zulip-server-*/scripts/setup/install --self-signed-cert \
--email=.............(has an email I just took it out) --hostname=Zac
it doesnt work

Hi again blackbird, I appreciate your DM a few moments ago but ask that you please remain in a public stream while awaiting someone to assist you. I personally am logging off for the weekend shortly but I know we have community members and fellow Zulip employees versed in the self-hosted server in this stream who may be able to help asynchronously as they come (back) online.
okay thanks

blackbirdzac said:

./zulip-server-*/scripts/setup/install --self-signed-cert \
--email=.............(has an email I just took it out) --hostname=Zac

However, before I log out - based on your post in #issues ^ it would appear you're giving a local-network-only hostname, and not a world-accessible hostname. In general Zulip instances need to be at publicly resolvable URLs, see the Install Guide:

--hostname=zulip.example.com: The user-accessible domain name for this Zulip server, i.e., what users will type in their web browser. This becomes EXTERNAL_HOST (docs) in the Zulip settings.

And so you might be looking for something like --hostname=zulip.zac.example.com or whatever your public domain is. With that, I'm off for the evening and weekend
image.png
Can you run tail -n30 /var/log/zulip/errors.log and use a code block to paste the results here?
there are alot of errors
image.png
what is code block sorry I am new to this
it is broken again

Please keep your replies here, in #production help, and not in other streams.

You can read about code blocks in the link I had above: https://zulip.com/help/code-blocks

In short, if you write this:

some text
```
copy-and pasted text
goes
here
```

It will look like:

some text

copy-and pasted text
goes
here

...which is helpful for reading things like error messages.

But your error is exactly what Josh Klar was telling you above -- Zulip needs to have a hostname which is a publicly-accessible host name, like chat.zulip.org, not my-special-host or zac-virtual-machine.
why does it need that when it will be on a private network not accessible to the public world
sorrry I am hella new to all of this and am learning
also when I make it a valid url it doesnt let me connect to it (my network is not connected to the internet that I wanted this setup on) image.png
It doesn't need to necessarily be public -- it just needs to be a hostname that the host itself can resolve to be itself, and that you, as a user of the site, can also resolve.
can anyone call so ican ss?

@blackbirdzac it sounds like you need extended support with setting Zulip up on an isolated network. You should buy an installation support contract; we don't have the resources to do support over calls with folks who are not paying customers.
